2633.name: Acidmaw
2633.text: Whenever an enemy minion takes damage, destroy it.
2633.flavorText: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

2758.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
2758.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.
2758.flavorText: "Put more spikes on her. No, more spikes. What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand? MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

2586.name: Anub'arak
2586.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/4 Nerubian with "Deathrattle: Summon Anub'arak."
2586.flavorText: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

2572.name: Arcane Blast
2572.text: Deal 2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

2720.name: Argent Lance
2720.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.
2720.flavorText: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

2505.name: Argent Watchman
2505.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.
2505.flavorText: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

2627.name: Armored Warhorse
2627.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
2627.flavorText: Yep. It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

2785.name: Astral Communion
2785.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
2785.flavorText: Hey! Moon! Can I have some mana crystals?

2796.name: Aviana
2796.flavorText: Call her "Tweety". She'll find it real funny. I PROMISE.

2483.name: Ball of Spiders
2483.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners with "Deathrattle: Get a random Beast."

2729.name: Bash
2729.flavorText: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice. It doesn't.

2641.name: Bear Trap
2641.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
2641.flavorText: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

2587.name: Beneath the Grounds
2587.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2587.flavorText: Can you hold these eggs for just a second? I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

2595.name: Bolf Ramshield
2595.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
2595.flavorText: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament. It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

2754.name: Bolster
2754.flavorText: The best offense is a good defense.

2495.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
2495.flavorText: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones. Okay, maybe just bones.

2642.name: Brave Archer
2642.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

2715.name: Buccaneer
2715.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
2715.flavorText: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

2770.name: Burgle
2770.text: Get 3 random cards (from your opponent's class).

2522.name: Captured Jormungar
2522.flavorText: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

2617.name: Charged Hammer
2617.flavorText: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

2682.name: Chillmaw
2682.text: Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
2682.flavorText: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

2500.name: Clockwork Knight
2500.flavorText: It takes a lot to wind him up.

2544.name: Coldarra Drake
2544.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
2544.flavorText: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

2585.name: Coliseum Manager
2585.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
2585.flavorText: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

2648.name: Competitive Spirit
2648.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
2648.flavorText: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself. Or kill all the competitors.

2556.name: Confessor Paletress
2556.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.
2556.flavorText: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears. Most common fear: Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

2564.name: Confuse
2564.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

2563.name: Convert
2563.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand. It costs (1).

2518.name: Crowd Favorite
2518.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

2766.name: Cutpurse
2766.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
2766.flavorText: He has a giant collection of purses now. One for every outfit!

2549.name: Dalaran Aspirant
2549.flavorText: Is he aspiring or inspiring? Make up your mind!

2632.name: Dark Bargain
2632.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
2632.flavorText: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

2782.name: Darnassus Aspirant
2782.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
2782.flavorText: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals. So fickle!

2535.name: Demonfuse
2535.flavorText: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

2613.name: Draenei Totemcarver
2613.flavorText: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

2533.name: Dragonhawk Rider
2533.flavorText: Check it out. You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

2634.name: Dreadscale
2634.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all enemies.
2634.flavorText: Let's be clear about this: ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

2822.name: Dreadsteed
2822.text: Deathrattle: At the end of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.
2822.flavorText: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament. Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

2783.name: Druid of the Saber
2783.text: Choose One - Transform into a 2/1 with Charge; or a 3/2 with Stealth.
2783.flavorText: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades. That's a different kind of druid. Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

2727.name: Eadric the Pure
2727.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.
2727.flavorText: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

2541.name: Effigy
2541.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

2620.name: Elemental Destruction
2620.flavorText: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

2654.name: Enter the Coliseum
2654.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
2654.flavorText: You have to get past the vendors first. So many are lost to shopping...

2752.name: Evil Heckler
2752.flavorText: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

2519.name: Eydis Darkbane
2519.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

2545.name: Fallen Hero
2545.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

2624.name: Fearsome Doomguard
2624.flavorText: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

2581.name: Fencing Coach
2581.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
2581.flavorText: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

2628.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
2628.text: When you play or discard this, deal 4 damage to a random enemy.

2748.name: Fjola Lightbane
2748.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

2580.name: Flame Juggler
2580.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2580.flavorText: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better! Because FIRE!"

2539.name: Flame Lance
2539.flavorText: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

2532.name: Frigid Snobold
2532.flavorText: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

2512.name: Frost Giant
2512.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
2512.flavorText: Don't ask him about the beard. JUST DON'T.

2818.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
2818.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
2818.flavorText: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

2517.name: Garrison Commander
2517.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
2517.flavorText: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

2724.name: Gormok the Impaler
2724.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
2724.flavorText: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds. For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

2510.name: Grand Crusader
2510.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
2510.flavorText: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness. Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

2612.name: Healing Wave
2612.text: Restore 8 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 16 instead.
2612.flavorText: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

2555.name: Holy Champion
2555.flavorText: She really likes seeing people get better. That's why she hurts them in the first place.

2594.name: Ice Rager
2594.flavorText: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

2725.name: Icehowl
2725.flavorText: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target. The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

2502.name: Injured Kvaldir
2502.flavorText: Don't worry. With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

2736.name: Justicar Trueheart
2736.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
2736.flavorText: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

2756.name: King's Defender
2756.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
2756.flavorText: "King's Attacker" is a shield. Funny, huh?

2635.name: King's Elekk
2635.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

2788.name: Knight of the Wild
2788.text: Costs (1) less for each Beast you've summoned this game.
2788.flavorText: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

2598.name: Kodorider
2598.flavorText: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

2511.name: Kvaldir Raider
2511.flavorText: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

2577.name: Lance Carrier
2577.flavorText: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies. A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

2259.name: Light's Champion
2259.flavorText: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

2792.name: Living Roots
2792.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
2792.flavorText: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

2484.name: Lock and Load
2484.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, get a random Hunter card.
2484.flavorText: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time. Lock and load." This card pays homage to that special moment.

2753.name: Magnataur Alpha
2753.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.
2753.flavorText: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

2488.name: Maiden of the Lake
2488.flavorText: Not a good basis for a system of government.

2507.name: Master Jouster
2507.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
2507.flavorText: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

2493.name: Master of Ceremonies
2493.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

2491.name: Mogor's Champion
2491.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2491.flavorText: This champion has learned from the best. Except for his target selection.

2497.name: Mukla's Champion
2497.flavorText: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

2793.name: Mulch
2793.text: Destroy a minion. Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
2793.flavorText: Is this a noun or a verb? We will never know.

2655.name: Murloc Knight
2655.flavorText: Hee hee! Look at his cute little feet.

2726.name: Mysterious Challenger
2726.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
2726.flavorText: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

2683.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
2683.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
2683.flavorText: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion. Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

2520.name: North Sea Kraken
2520.flavorText: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

2711.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
2711.flavorText: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

2521.name: Pit Fighter
2521.flavorText: What did the pits ever do to you?

2763.name: Poisoned Blade
2763.text: Your Hero Power gives this +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
2763.flavorText: How much more poisoned can a blade get? The answer is a lot. A lot more poisoned.

2542.name: Polymorph: Boar
2542.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

2568.name: Power Word: Glory
2568.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2568.flavorText: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding. Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

2638.name: Powershot
2638.text: Deal 2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

2552.name: Ram Wrangler
2552.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
2552.flavorText: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

2509.name: Recruiter
2509.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
2509.flavorText: Join the Argent Crusade! We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

2704.name: Refreshment Vendor
2704.flavorText: Menu: Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks. It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

2546.name: Rhonin
2546.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

2576.name: Saboteur
2576.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
2576.flavorText: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

2780.name: Savage Combatant
2780.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.
2780.flavorText: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him. Yeah... Try that.

2723.name: Sea Reaver
2723.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
2723.flavorText: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

2717.name: Seal of Champions
2717.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

2765.name: Shado-Pan Rider
2765.flavorText: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

2566.name: Shadowfiend
2566.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
2566.flavorText: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

2768.name: Shady Dealer
2768.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
2768.flavorText: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

2579.name: Silent Knight
2579.flavorText: He used to be a librarian. Old habits die hard.

2503.name: Silver Hand Regent
2503.flavorText: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization. The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

2757.name: Skycap'n Kragg
2757.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
2757.flavorText: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat? NOTHING.

2551.name: Spawn of Shadows
2551.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.
2551.flavorText: What did you expect to happen? He's a Spawn. Of Shadows.

2571.name: Spellslinger
2571.text: Battlecry: Both players get a random spell. Yours costs (2) less.
2571.flavorText: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about. Who can say?

2639.name: Stablemaster
2639.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
2639.flavorText: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

2618.name: The Mistcaller
2618.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
2618.flavorText: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great. "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

2681.name: The Skeleton Knight
2681.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
2681.flavorText: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

2615.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
2615.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.
2615.flavorText: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating. I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

2777.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
2777.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +2/+1.
2777.flavorText: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

2610.name: Totem Golem
2610.flavorText: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

2499.name: Tournament Attendee
2499.flavorText: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament. He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

2575.name: Tournament Medic
2575.flavorText: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

2504.name: Tuskarr Jouster
2504.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
2504.flavorText: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

2513.name: Tuskarr Totemic
2513.flavorText: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

2569.name: Twilight Guardian
2569.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2569.flavorText: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

2767.name: Undercity Valiant
2767.flavorText: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

2760.name: Varian Wrynn
2760.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
2760.flavorText: Leader of the Alliance! Father of Anduin! Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

2537.name: Void Crusher
2537.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

2515.name: Warhorse Trainer
2515.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +2 Attack and Taunt.
2515.flavorText: He doesn't even get Sundays off. Every day he's hostling.

2786.name: Wildwalker
2786.flavorText: She was born to be something. She is just not quite sure what yet...

2621.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
2621.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
2621.flavorText: He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*. *He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

2623.name: Wrathguard
2623.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
2623.flavorText: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

2596.name: Wyrmrest Agent
2596.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2596.flavorText: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority 1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
